    css: styles.css

<div class="lesson-card">
  <h2>Congratulations! You’ve reached the end of Lesson 3: Buccal or Blood Game</h2>

  <p>
    You correctly identified
    <strong><span id="score-fraction">—</span></strong>
    cell images.
    That’s
    <strong><span id="score-percent">—</span></strong>
    accuracy.
  </p>

  <p id="score-summary">
    <!-- This will be filled in by the script below -->
  </p>

  <a href="buccal.html"><button class="btn">Retry</button></a>
  <a href="index3.html"><button class="btn">Home</button></a>
  <a href="certificate.html"><button class="btn">Next</button></a>
</div>

<script>
window.addEventListener('DOMContentLoaded', () => {
  // Read totals from localStorage
  const score = Number(localStorage.getItem('lesson3Score') || 0);
  const totalCorrect = Number(localStorage.getItem('lesson3Total') || 0); // should be 11
  const totalImages = 24; // 4 pages * 6 images each

  const percent = totalCorrect ? Math.round((score / totalCorrect) * 100) : 0;

  const fracSpan = document.getElementById('score-fraction');
  const percentSpan = document.getElementById('score-percent');
  const summaryP = document.getElementById('score-summary');

  if (fracSpan) {
    fracSpan.textContent = `${score} / ${totalCorrect}`;
  }

  if (percentSpan) {
    percentSpan.textContent = `${percent}%`;
  }

  if (summaryP) {
    summaryP.textContent = `There were ${totalCorrect} correct cell images across ` +
      `${totalImages} total images. You correctly identified ${score} of those ` +
      `${totalCorrect}.`;
  }
});
</script>
